content.text:
# King Qing of Zhou

| posthumous name = King Qing (頃王)
| father = King Xiang of Zhou
| issue = King Kuang of ZhouKing Ding of ZhouDuke Kang of Liu (劉康公)
}}
King Qing of Zhou (), personal name Ji Renchen, was a king of China's Zhou dynasty.
The son of King Xiang, King Qing ascended to the throne in 618 BC after his father died.
King Qing had three sons, Princes Ban (King Kuang), Yu and Jizi. After King Qing died in 613 BC, he was succeeded by Ban.
Family
Sons:
* Prince Ban (; d. 607 BC), ruled as King Kuang of Zhou from 612 to 607 BC
* Prince Yu (; d. 586 BC), ruled as King Ding of Zhou from 606 to 586 BC
* Prince Jizi (; d. 544 BC), ruled the State of Liu (劉國), known posthumously as Duke Kang of Liu (劉康公) from 592 to 544 BC
